🌤 2nd Place #CatchtheMorning photo! 🌤  Congrats @SiyiZ! You've won a Morandi Gray Travel Backpack! 🙌🏼 @SiyiZ explains the story behind her photo and how she aims to kick off the new year, "While solo-traveling to Greece recently, I made a spontaneous trip to Santorini for a day just so I can experience that amazing sunrise (and sunset!) in person. I think I was the only one awake and walking through the quiet town of Oía at 4:30 AM. When the sun slowly made its appearance over the Caldera with waves crashing ashore, I felt so at peace. It made me realize how truly astonishing nature is and how not to take even the smallest things for granted. Even though the sun rises everyday without a doubt, it also comes with new opportunities. With the new year, I'm planning to seize every chance I get to travel and explore this amazing world. Adventure is out there!" #ShotonOnePlus

Location: Billund, Denmark Aperture: F/1.7 Shutterspeed: 1/785 sec. ISO: 200"

😱 Incredible perspective shooting staircases with the amazing @giogargiulo. How did his capture this shot with the #OnePlus5T?👇 Read below:
"Architecture and central framing go well together, creating strong compositions and visual impact. For this shot I chose to use Pro Mode, which allowed me to perfectly nail my exposure and drive the eyes right at the center." #ShotonOnePlus
#theworldneedsmorespiralstaircases

Think fast! 💪 😱  #OnePlus5T user @fabioesanto tells us the story of this spontaneous shot:
"The decisive moment is out there to be shot. That’s why most of the time I shoot with a mobile rather than with a camera – it’s always with us and it never lets us down. That day I was walking around in Parque das Nações after a shooting day and I decided to cross the garden just to take a shortcut. That’s when I saw this moment of joy with the kid below the waterfall.
Even though the waterfall was hiding the sun, the day was bright as most of the days we have in Lisbon. I changed my Pro Mode settings to ISO 125 (the lower the better) and I set a faster shutter to frozen the composition without a tripod. The #OnePlus5T is magical and so quick I never lose a chance to get that perfect photo.
"  #ShotonOnePlus

How does effortlessly @alessandromichelazzi capture great portraits? 😍 Read below for his story behind this photo:
"I’ve shot this picture with Alessia in the old town of Trieste. For the shooting, I’ve asked the model to wear something colorful (as usual! 😀 ) and we decided to go with this combination of blue-jeans and yellow shirt.
 While we were walking in the city center I’ve noticed this old-blue window frame. I’ve asked the model to sit as she was relaxed or waiting for someone, then I’ve used the portrait mode to blur the background.
 I want to point that, the new portrait mode on the #OnePlus5T works with the wide lens. In this way, you can get a blur effect that usually is difficult to achieve even with the bigger sensor camera with the wide lens!
" #ShotonOnePlus

🌄 Here's a #Oneplus5T sunrise photo to talk about! @manumanuti tells us about the time he went out at 3am to catch a sunrise in #mexico 🇲🇽 "A couple of friends and I met at 3 am to go to Nevado de Toluca, an active Volcano close to Mexico City famous for its fantastic landscapes. Obviously, when we entered the dirt road, we got lost somewhere along the way, where there was no light or signal - that's how horror movies begin - we all thought at the same time. We arrived just at sunrise and it was extraordinary beautiful. It was our first time up there - how cold it was. At 6:30 AM the sky painted itself with blue, pink, orange -many beautiful colors; the mountains and the absolute nature were covered by a magic light, making it perfect to shoot some photos with portrait mode.Then we began the tortuous climb that was rewarded with an indefinable sight. At the end we rolled downhill to the icy Moon Lagoon, and after some time playing barefoot in the pristine water, we went back to pick up the car and drove back to the city." #ShotonOnePlus

👑 @manumanuti, king of low-light shares his story behind this amazing photo:
"This year I ran my fifth marathon in #Toronto #Canada and the day of the race, after a deserved nap, I decided to take a night walk. Since I started taking pictures, I have always been fascinated by reflections, so I decided to try it, taking advantage of the recent rain. It was not easy because of the cars that passed continuously, one of them totally bathed me with an urban tsunami, but I didn't care. For better shots of reflexes, I usually bend down as much as I can and turn the cell phone 180º so that the camera is as close as possible to the water. Then I took a bus and headed to the nice Distillery District, famous for its restaurants and craft breweries that turn on their bright neons to attract people. The #OnePlus5T automatic camera adapts very well to these strong contrasts of night light, and allows to adjust the lighting when focusing the object with the tip of the finger. Many of the times, a tripod is not even necessary for shots like these. "

🗻💖 #OnePlus5T user @manumanuti shares his story behind this breathtaking photo from #Argentina:
"Ushuaia, Argentina is the southernmost city on the planet and it’s said to be the gateway to the end of the world. During my stay I visited several photogenic places, including the one in this image. It was a wooden lodge with a hatchery of beautiful Huskies that are used during the winter to pull sledges. In front of it there was this small lake that reflected the Andes on the horizon. Great natural landscapes with a tiny human presence that increase the effect of immensity and majesty. The photo was taken in Pro Mode, which allowed me to adjust the ISO, and speed. For photos like this the ideal is also to use the grid and play with the symmetry, placing the subject right in the middle. After this place, we continued with the tour to Hidden Lake and Fagnano Lake."
***

🚤 We asked incredible #OnePlus5 photographer @suissemoi for his story behind this shot. Read below!👇 ---
"This pic was taken spontaneously in Switzerland, at the moment of the sunset above the Leman lake. I was inline skating near the port, which is my favorite spot since I was kid. When I saw this public boat approaching, I moved very fast towards the embarkment to take picture of it. This photo works mostly thanks to the light, but the design of the boat, which is one of the oldest boats on the lake, as well as the Alps behind are also very strong elements here."
---

Wonder how one of our favorite #OnePlus5 users @javin_lau shot this incredible photo at #brooklynpier? 😱 Read below!👇 ---
"Twilight from Brooklyn. This photo was shot in Manual Mode because I wanted to expose the photo for 3-5 seconds to ensure that the water would appear to be flowing in the photo, as well as ensure that I could lower my ISO to reduce the noise. RAW capture was also a key consideration as well, to ensure a higher dynamic range for post processing. This photo was edited in Lightroom with both shadow and highlight adjustments, and toning to get the colours just right."
---

I hope you are all enjoying #WorldPhotographyDay!

Camera settings: f/2 | 1/250sec | ISO-100

Hello everyone, it's @sagesolar here, sharing some of my photos with you. I hope everyone is enjoying their weekend so far. 
I took this photo with the #OnePlus3 at one of my favourite weekend destinations, Uppark House in #WestSussex. 
Camera settings: f/2 | 1/1600sec | ISO-100

Hello everyone, it's @sagesolar again. I hope everyone has had a great day!

I took this photo with the #OnePlus3 on a seaside pier near where I live in #BognorRegis. I really like how the detail in the boardwalk was captured. The camera is great for #blackAndWhite photos too. 
Edited in Pixlr to convert to black and white.

Camera settings: f/2 | 1/30sec | ISO-100

Hey everyone @sagesolar here, sharing some more of my photos with you. I hope you're all having a great weekend. 
I took this photo of a partly cloudy and starry night sky with a tripod mounted #OnePlus3. I was on the #SouthDowns hills in West Sussex, about two hours after sunset. I was really impressed with how well the camera was able to capture the stars and the detail of the tower so late at night using a long exposure.

If anyone would like to know more about #astrophotography or the editing process, please leave a comment or message my @sagesolar account, and I'll get in touch. 
Edited in Lightroom to reduce pixel noise and to enhance the details.

Camera settings: f/2 | 30sec | ISO-3200

Hey everyone @sagesolar here, this is the last photo I would like to share this weekend. I hope you all enjoy your week ahead, and thank you for all your likes and comments.

I took this star trail photo on a clear summer night with a tripod mounted #OnePlus3 pointing at the Pole Star. I was on the #SouthDowns hills in West Sussex, about four hours after sunset. This photo is a composite of 70 individual exposures, which I later combined in star trail software to achieve the circular trails.

If anyone would like to know more about #astrophotography, #startrails or the editing process, please leave a comment or message my @sagesolar account, and I'll get in touch. 
Edited in Startrails.de to combine the original exposures, and in Lightroom to reduce pixel noise and to enhance the details.

Camera settings: f/2 | 35min (70 x 30sec) | ISO-2000
